intro: Discocalyx palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan discocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its sprawling growth habit and large, lobed leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a round, fleshy berry that contains numerous seeds.
